intro: Saurauia setidens, commonly known as the clustered hoya, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Convulvulaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is evergreen and typically grows as a shrub or vine, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom during the warmer months. Saurauia setidens is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
